item.title: Sync Obsidian Notes With Git And Syncthing
item.description:
Taking notes and building my Zettelkasten is becoming an increasingly crucial part of my life. I’m able to reflect on how I’m feeling and what I’m learning, making connections I wouldn’t otherwise.

One important aspect of notetaking is being able to take notes on multiple devices wherever I am. In this article, I’ll explain how I set up the integration between my devices using Git and Syncthing.

The Problem Link to heading

As of 2024 the Obsidian Git Plugin support git integration on Android, but only via https. As I’m using a private Github repository to store my notes, I did not feel comfortable storing a access key on my smartphone. So how could I sync my notes then ?

item.title: What I'm doing now ?
item.description:
Last updated at 2024-09-21.

  • A little obsessed about note taking and Zettelkasten
  • Reading The Art Of Unix Programming
  • Building my homelab, soon you will find more posts here about this journey

This is a now page, a place to share what I’m currently doing at the moment. To learn more, click here
You can reach me via Telegram or send me an email at me@leotsgo.dev

item.title: About
item.description:
Hello! I’m Leo, a Software Engineer and SRE from Brazil! Link to heading

I started my career in a CRM startup, where I worked as a Full Stack Software Engineer. With a small team on the Integrations Squad, I started to learn about Reliability and DevOps practices out of necessity, which lead me to a job as a Site Reliability Engineer in one of brazillian’s largest banks.
